text: Burst may refer to: *Burst mode, events happen very quickly **Burst transmission, a term in telephone or data operation. **Burst switching, a feature of some packet switched networks. **Bursting, the way neurons work. **Burst mode (firearm), a mode where a firearm may fire a set amount of rounds. *Burst phase, a feature of the PAL television format *Burst fracture, a type of spinal injury, where the spine is hurt. *Burst charge, a piece of some fireworks *Burst noise, type of electronic noise that occurs in semiconductors.
title: Burst
